metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2031 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in Samba. The security vulnerability occurs when KDC and the kpasswd service share a single account and set of keys, allowing them to decrypt each other's tickets. A user who has been requested to change their password, can exploit this flaw to obtain and use tickets to other services.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Fixing this in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS would require substantial code backports. We will not be fixing this issue in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. In environments where this is of concern, we recommend updating to a more recent Ubuntu version, or disabling kpasswd if this is not passible.

criterions.comment: samba: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
